conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and geometry of objects.
A is the shadow of the cylindrical object.

The light source moves to the front right, away from the objects.
Shadows will shift towards the back left, opposite to the direction of the light source movement.
Shadows will become smaller because the light source is moving away from the objects.
Shadow A will move towards the back left and become smaller.
Shadow B will move towards the back left and become smaller.
Shadow C will move towards the back left and become smaller.
Shadow D will move towards the back left and become smaller.
All shadows will shift towards the back left and decrease in size.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the back left and become smaller.
